it is caused by spawn camera in world, but this error won't happened at the beginning, it only happened when I running program for a while, like couple of hours. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nsubiron>@nsubiron</denchmark-link>

I'm facing a similar issue when using the ros-bridge (and starting/stopping another client). I believe the issue is related to having two clients accessing the data. My clients:
ros-bridge manual_control.py
You can reproduce it like that.
execute ros-bridge Restart manual_control.py every 4 seconds (e.g with the help of this script)
<denchmark-code>#!/usr/bin/env python import signal import subprocess import time
ret = 0 while ret is 0: pro = subprocess.Popen("./manual_control.py") time.sleep(4) pro.terminate() pro.wait() ret = pro.returncode print("returned {}".format(ret)) </denchmark-code>
Afer a few restarts of manual-control, the ROS bridge will report the error and stops.

It looks like it's a bug inside LibCarla, related to the client objects used to subscribe to a sensor. I'll try to create a minimal test reproducing this in C++. Unfortunately we won't be able to fix it for 0.9.5.

When runnng ros_bridge, I commented line 167 of parent.py self.child_actors[actor_id].destroy() This has greatly improved ros_bridge stability; I expect it is causing a double delete attempt in the python API code ...

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/oldtopos>@oldtopos</denchmark-link> What you're describing is a different issue, which is, as you already stated ros-bridge only. I've create an issue in ros-bridge > <denchmark-link:https://github.com/carla-simulator/ros-bridge/issues/133>carla-simulator/ros-bridge#133</denchmark-link>
This should be solved now in 0.9.8.
